messages.title: Safeguarding our emergency services
messages.content: Residents across Montgomeryshire have been shocked and alarmed at plans to save £1.2 million by replacing full-time frontline firefighters with volunteers. There are currently 21 full-time firefighters in Powys. These could all be replaced by retained crews.

messages.title: Wyn says Yes to fairer votes
messages.content: Wyn Williams tells Montgomeryshire Life why he is backing the campaign in the National Assembly elections, this time, Wales along with the rest of the UK, has a chance to choose a new and fairer voting system for Westminster elections - the Alternative Vote (AV).

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes plans to replace full-time firefighters with volunteers; implies importance of professional emergency services.
Supports the Alternative Vote (AV) system for fairer votes in Westminster elections.

politicalExperience.achievements: Attended key stakeholder meetings with firefighters and has heard about the problem first hand.

images.caption: Wyn Williams taking part in a charity 'spinathon' organised by the Welshpool firefighters.
